articles.title: They got hacked with NSO spyware. Now Israel wants Palestinian activists' funding cut - NPR
articles.description: A battle over Palestinian activist groups that Israel accuses of terrorism has taken a turn into the world of Israeli spyware. Israel hopes to convince European countries to stop funding the groups.
articles.content: A logo adorns a wall on a branch of the Israeli NSO Group company, near the southern Israeli town of Sapir. The cellphones of six Palestinian human rights activists were infected with spyware from th… [+8860 chars]

articles.author: Vanessa Gera, Monika Scislowska and Geir Moulson
articles.title: EU accuses Belarus of 'trafficking' migrants toward border - CTV News
articles.description: European Union officials on Wednesday accused Belarus of state-sponsored 'trafficking' of human lives by luring desperate migrants to the Polish border - the edge of the EU - where many are now stuck in makeshift camps in freezing weather.
articles.content:
WARSAW, POLAND --
